Class DeviceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • DeviceController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DeviceController
extends java.lang.Thread
    Device Controller for a generic 3D printer

    DeviceController can be created any time prior to or when the printer connection is started A serial port name and baud rate must be supplied to the connectSerial() method in order to connect to a printer Printing jobs can be started with startPrintJob() - see the method for more info pause/resume/stopJob() control the state of the current print job Only one job can be run at once, isJobRunning() check if one is running Call disconnectSerial() prior to ending the program or dispoising of a DeviceController instance processing.serial.* must also be imported in the main Processing applet to use this class

      • connectSerial

        public void connectSerial(java.lang.String port,
                          int baudRate)
        Starts a thread for serial communication
        Parameters:
        port - A string containing the name of the serial port to connect to
        baudRate - The baud rate of the serial port to connect to

      • disconnectSerial

        public boolean disconnectSerial()
        Closes serial port connection
        Returns:
        Returns true if the serial port was disconnected successfuly

      • run

        public void run()
        Main method used by the DeviceController thread. Please do not call this, it is only public because of the structure of the Thread class
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • startPrintJob

        public boolean startPrintJob(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> GCodeFile)
        Starts a new print job using the supplied GCode. A new print job will not startTime if a current job is in progress, or a serial port is not connected
        Parameters:
        GCodeFile - An array list containing GCode to be sent to the printer
        Returns:
        Returns true if a new job was started successfuly
